title: Aborigines in the Alice (A)
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Aboriginal Australia/Aboriginal Australians - Health and hygiene
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Infants - Mortality
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Aboriginal Australians - Social conditions
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Racism - Australia
description: Episode of Series "Four corners (Television program)". Looks at two problems facing aborigines in Alice Springs - child care and alcoholism. In 1970 the death rate among Aboriginal children rose to nearly 1 in 5, one of the highest infant mortality rates in the world. Today the ratio has improved, but Aboriginal health still presents a grim picture. Interviews people concerned. Reporter: Brian King; Photographer: Richard Bailie-Mace; Sound: Peter Lipscomb.
